article.headline: Iona 68, Long Island U. 61
article.story: EDS: APNewsNow. Iona 68, Long Island U. 61. NEW YORK -- Kashif Pratt had 12 points and Iona snapped a four-game losing streak with a 68-61 victory over Long Island University on Wednesday night. Scott Machado and Devon Clarke each added 11 points for the Gaels (3-5), who played their second game without Gary Springer, their leading scorer (12.7) and rebounder (6.0). The senior injured his ankle in a loss to Marist last week. Kyle Johnson had 14 points and 13 rebounds and Julian Boyd added 14 points and 10 rebounds for the Blackbirds (2-5), who finished with a 47-31 rebound advantage. LIU led 53-51 with 4 minutes to play. Jamal Jenkins made two free throws that tied the game and started Iona's run that gave the Gaels a 63-53 lead on a layup by Machado with 1:30 to go. Both teams struggled from 3-point range with Iona finishing 6-for-26 while the Blackbirds were 4-of-21.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
